creator: jlawson-apache@bovine.net
text:
We are running Linux kernel 2.4.18-18.7.x on Red Hat Linux release 7.2 with 
Apache 2.0.44 compiled from source.  When Apache's error logging has been 
redirected to syslog via the following httpd.conf directive:

ErrorLog syslog:local1

Then the STDERR of CGI processes is expected to be sent to syslog as well.  
However, when the mpm_worker is used no STDERR output is sent there (though 
other Apache error log messages, such as 404's and other messages are properly 
sent to syslog).

When the mpm_prefork model is used, everything works as expected (CGI STDERR, 
404 error messages, and others) are properly sent to syslog.

Created attachment 5275
sample CGI script that writes to STDOUT and STDERR
creator: jlawson-apache@bovine.net
jlawson-apache@bovine.net
text:
Note that when we are using mpm_worker we are using mod_cgid.  And when we are 
using mpm_prefork we are using mod_cgi.

Perhaps this is related to bug 14090 in some way?  However for us, altering 
our httpd.conf to use ErrorLog to a flatfile (instead of syslog), allows 
STDERR error logging to work properly for both the mpm_worker+mod_cgid and the 
mpm_prefork+mod_cgi cases.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text: also: errors don't go to vhost-specific error logs of any type with mod_cgid

Seems like this is really a bug report about mod_cgid not capturing stderr.
